5_19xyLs9tyTZF9JaEcWBk5JtgWdYtQPQwt3.body: I think user-end scripting would be the best method that doesn't approach censorship or a monetary gate. Have it recognize patterns that are long and exactly the same to begin with, and possibly be a site with user voted on submissions later to mark things as spam. Just a couple places to start.

5_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6.body:
> [cosmologica](#comment_66_1PiXrhT1UjMZmJc5WFhfUxourdfapeHJ8o): I have a question too. So, I am experimenting a little with this FreeNet. And on both Windows and Linux the pc shuts down / gives a blue screen. I think this is strange. What could be the cause of this?

Sounds more like a hardware problem than a software one. Use Linux to "apt-get install memtest86+", or the equivalent in your OS. Then you can reboot and it'll be a boot option, it'll let you know if you have a RAM issue. If it crashes *during* the test at the same point multiple times, it's probably a bad RAM slot on your motherboard.
